Pre-Game Insights: Iceland kickstart their UEFA Nations League campaign with a home game against Montenegro.
Iceland did well to beat star-studded England in a June friendly, but Netherlands proved to be a big catch for them at De Kuip.
A man to watch in the home team will be talented midfielder Hakon Haraldsson, who has established himself as one of the best Lille players.
Gent attacker Andri Gudjohnsen made the cut as well.
The visitors, Montenegro, suffered a 3-1 loss to Georgia in their last warm-up game.
Atletico Madrid defender Stefan Savic and Stevan Jovetic are the most notable players in the away team.
When the two national teams met in a friendly back in 2021, Montenegro defeated Iceland 2-1, meaning that the hosts are hungry for revenge.
